A2A :) It has to be 'Lag jaa gale'. I have been in love with the original composition since the first time I heard it, ages ago. The song is pure melody to my ears and it always manages to have a soothing effect on me.  Moreover, it makes me feel loved. It's got that age old charm with it, you know, a fine example of 'Old is Gold'? My first time hearing it is another unusual story. A few years back, I had been to Inorbit Mall in Pune and Sanam Puri and Co. was at the venue, making an entry into the music industry. He sang most of his songs and then began with 'Lag jaa gale'. Not only did he look amazing that day but his voice too just blew me over. Everyone there just went crazy, hooting and shouting for him.  That day when I saw him singing, he was dressed smartly (jaw droppingly handsome, to me :P) in a white coat and a black trouser. Inside me this thought kept churning, a burning desire did arise in me to run to the stage and probably hug him or maybe even better kiss him. (Swooning in delight, fortunately I wasn't the only one there) This was the beginning of my addiction to this song, on a daily basis as of now. When I play it, I prefer to shut the outside world and then all I can visualize are the mesmerizing words and Sanam's equally spellbinding voice. So if ever I'm to listen to just one song and survive for eternity, it has to be this song.  Listen to any version of this song sung by anyone, be it Arijit Singh or Shreya Ghoshal, you’ll feel good. May be it is the composition or the lyrics, that makes it mesmerizing enough to be listened to, forever.
